channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Raducanu given potential Sabalenka obstacle in Melbourne
item.description: Emma Raducanu is handed a potential third-round match against world number one Aryna Sabalenka at the Australian Open.

item.title: GB's Fery qualifies for first overseas Grand Slam
item.description: Britain's Arthur Fery qualifies for his first overseas Grand Slam by beating Dino Prizmic to reach the Australian Open main draw.

item.title: Raducanu beaten by world number 204 in Hobart
item.description: Emma Raducanu's Australian Open preparations suffer a blow as she loses to world number 204 Taylah Preston at the Hobart International.

item.title: Federer backs Alcaraz to complete career Slam in Melbourne
item.description: Roger Federer says he hopes Carlos Alcaraz can win the upcoming Australian Open and become the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam.

item.title: Amateur stuns world's best to win A$1m in Melbourne
item.description: Amateur Jordan Smith is the shock winner of the Million Dollar One Point Slam at the Australian Open, beating reigning men's champion Jannik Sinner along the way.

item.title: More money and bigger say - are top-10 stars being reasonable?
item.description: As another Grand Slam season dawns, many players still believe they are undervalued and denied a voice in key decisions made by the majors.

item.title: How to follow Australian Open across the BBC
item.description: Jannik Sinner and Madison Keys begin their Australian Open title defences from Sunday - and you can follow it across the BBC.

item.title: Ofner's Australian Open despair after celebrating too early
item.description: Sebastian Ofner is out of Australian Open qualifying after forgetting the rules and celebrating victory early - before going on to lose eight of the next nine points.

item.title: Raducanu earns first win of season after rain delay
item.description: Emma Raducanu claims her first victory of the season, beating Camila Osorio at the Hobart International after their match was suspended by rain on Tuesday.

item.title: The junior Slam champion who match-fixed to 'escape' tennis
item.description: Shortly after winning the 2016 Australian Open boys' title, a disillusioned Oliver Anderson was arrested for throwing a set - now he is rebuilding his career.

item.title: 'My daughters are fans of Venus, so it was tough'
item.description: Tatjana Maria beats Venus Williams in straight sets in the first round at the Hobart Internationa.

item.title: From 421st to top 10 - Bencic eyes Australian Open glory
item.description: Belinda Bencic returns to the top 10 for the first time since giving birth to her daughter Bella.

item.title: Sabalenka beats Kostyuk to win third Brisbane title
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka prepares for the Australian Open with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Marta Kostyuk to win a third Brisbane International title.

item.title: GB's Evans out in first round of Melbourne qualifying
item.description: Dan Evans is one of four Britons to lose in the first round of Australian Open qualifying at Melbourne Park.

item.title: Former Wimbledon finalist Raonic retires
item.description: Former Wimbledon finalist Milos Raonic says he has been the "luckiest person" to live out his dreams as he announces his retirement at the age of 35.

item.title: ITF to review wildcard entries after viral performance
item.description: The International Tennis Federation says it will review its procedures for awarding wildcards after a female player's "unacceptable" performance went viral on social media.

item.title: Poland beat Switzerland for debut United Cup title
item.description: Poland battle back to beat Switzerland 2-1 in the United Cup final in Sydney to win the mixed-gender tournament for the first time.

item.title: Wawrinka handed Australian Open wildcard in final season
item.description: Stan Wawrinka receives an Australian Open wildcard as he begins the final season of his career, but Australian Nick Kyrgios misses out.

item.title: Players 'not protected' over 'insane' schedule - Sabalenka
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka says tennis authorities "follow their interests" with regards to the tennis calendar and are not "focusing on protecting all of us".

item.title: 'No idea what just happened' - GB's Jones battles injury in Auckland win
item.description: Britain's Francesca Jones says she had "no idea what just happened" after battling injury to reach the Auckland Classic quarter-finals.

item.title: Australian Open offers record prize money - but stars still 'disappointed'
item.description: The Australian Open will offer a record prize pot of £55m at this year's tournament - but players are still likely to be unhappy a source says.

item.title: Norrie wins and Kyrgios' return ends in defeat
item.description: Nick Kyrgios' first ATP Tour match since March ends in a first-round defeat at the Brisbane International, as Britain's Cameron Norrie books his place in the second round with a hard-fought win.

item.title: Battle of the Sexes 'brought eyes on tennis'
item.description: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka defends the 'Battle of the Sexes' match against Nick Kyrgios after opening her season with a crushing win in Brisbane.

item.title: Draper set to return from injury for GB in Davis Cup
item.description: Jack Draper, who has played one singles match since July, is set to return from injury in Great Britain's Davis Cup tie against Norway in February.

item.title: Djokovic cuts ties with player union he co-founded
item.description: Novak Djokovic says he has ended his involvement with the Professional Tennis Players Association that he co-founded, expressing concerns over "transparency and governance".

item.title: Watch: Amateur beats Sinner in One Point Slam title win
item.description: Watch amateur tennis player beat men's world number two Jannik Sinner and women's world number 117 Joanna Garland to earn A$1m (£496,835) in Australian Open's new Million Dollar One Point Slam.

item.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in 'Battle of the Sexes'
item.description: Watch the best moments between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: 'Point of the match!' - Sabalenka hits 'amazing' winner against Kyrgios
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka hits an 'amazing' return against Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: 1973 Battle of the Sexes was about social change - King
item.description: American tennis legend Billie Jean King says the upcoming 'Battle of the Sexes' match between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios is "not the same" as her 1973 victory over Bobby Riggs.

item.title: Sabalenka confident 'Battle of the Sexes' won't damage women's sport
item.description: BBC Sport speaks to Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios about their controversial Battle of the Sexes-style match, set to take place in Dubai on 28 December.

item.title: Women's tennis going in right direction - King
item.description: Billie Jean King, founder of the WTA, believes the organisation's billion-dollar deal with Mercedes shows the tour "continues to lead the way" in women's sport.

item.title: Boulter loses to Pegula as GB out of BJK Cup
item.description: Watch the best shots, as the United States' Jessica Pegula fights back from a set down to beat Katie Boulter and knock Great Britain out of the Billie Jean King Cup at the semi-final stage.

item.title: GB's Kartal runs Navarro close in BJK Cup semi-final
item.description: A battling Sonay Kartal falls to the United States' Emma Navarro, as Great Britain go 1-0 down in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.

item.title: When Billie Jean beat Bobby - the Battle of the Sexes that defined an era
item.description: When Aryna Sabalenka faces Nick Kyrgios, it will be under the banner of the Battle of the Sexes - but the stakes will not be as high as those that faced Billie Jean King 52 years ago.

item.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka - but what did 'Battle of the Sexes' achieve?
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Nick Kyrgios in a Battle of the Sexes-style match that lacked the intensity and entertainment promised in the build-up.

item.title: 'It gives me chills' - Italian 'brotherhood' inspires Davis Cup hat-trick
item.description: Flavio Cobolli and Matteo Berrettini lead Italy to a historic third straight Davis Cup title in Bologna.

item.title: Valuable lessons and tough losses - world number one Sabalenka's 2025
item.description: How some self-reflection on a mid-season holiday helped Aryna Sabalenka go from near-misses to year-end number one.

item.title: Is WTA Finals bringing change to Saudi Arabia?
item.description: The season-ending WTA Finals has been held for the second time in Saudi Arabia - a controversial move which continues to be scrutinised.

item.title: 'I'm always looking ahead' - Mboko eyes bright future
item.description: At the start of 2025, Victoria Mboko was ranked outside of the world's top 300. Now the teenager has cracked the top 20 after winning another WTA title.

item.title: Boulter win puts GB into BJK Cup semi-finals
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Katie Boulter's win over Moyuka Uchijima sees Great Britain secure a 2-0 win over Japan, setting up a Billie Jean King Cup semi-final with the United States.

item.title: GB's Kartal dominates Shibahara in BJK Cup match win
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Sonay Kartal beats Ena Shibahara of Japan to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead in their Billie Jean King Cup quarter-final tie.

item.title: Borg will fight cancer 'like it's a Wimbledon final'
item.description: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg says "I hope I'm gonna be OK" after being diagnosed with "extremely aggressive" prostate cancer.

item.title: How will GB cope without Raducanu in BJK Cup?
item.description: Emma Raducanu is missing the Billie Jean King Cup to focus on the WTA Tour.

item.title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

item.title: 'A dream come true' - Alcaraz on winning US Open & reaching world No 1
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says it's a "dream come true" after winning his second US Open title and regaining the No. 1 spot in the world rankings.

item.title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
item.description: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

item.title: 'Why would you say that?' - Swiatek unimpressed by reporter's question
item.description: World number two Iga Swiatek challenges a journalist after her US Open defeat against Amanda Anisimova, rejecting the suggestion that she needs a "mental break" after the straight sets loss at Flushing Meadows.

item.title: Anisimova gains revenge on Swiatek for Wimbledon final
item.description: Amanda Anisimova knocks Iga Swiatek out of the US Open, to gain revenge for her 6-0 6-0 defeat in the 2025 Wimbledon final.

item.title: Who has won tennis' 'Battle of the Sexes'?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team details the history of 'Battle of the Sexes' matches in tennis

item.title: What is US Open prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how much prize money is on offer at the US Open.

item.title: Why is there a pineapple on Wimbledon's men's trophy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why there is a pineapple on the top of the Wimbledon trophy for the winner of the men's singles.

item.title: Why were there no line judges at Wimbledon 2025?
item.description: Wimbledon are relying on electronic line calling to judge whether a ball is in or out.
